turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Believe it, sister. That's what brought our buddy back to life.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: And now he's going to use it to bring his girlfriend back

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: I'm with you, old man. No one touches my sister like that and gets away with it.

turns.speaker: O'CONNELL
turns.text: Okay, now what the hell does this Horus guy look like?

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: He's a big fellow with pointy ears and a face like a falcon.

turns.speaker: JONATHAN
turns.text: You have got to be joking?

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: I knew you'd come. I left that skylight open for you.

turns.speaker: AMAZING
turns.text: I know you knew I'd know.

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: But did you know I knew you'd know I'd know?

turns.speaker: AMAZING
turns.text: The jig is up, Casanova. I've spent six months watching you, and know exactly what you're up to.

turns.speaker: AMAZING
turns.text: I know that you're recruiting your old henchmen...

turns.speaker: AMAZING
turns.text: And I know the terrible revenge that you plan to inflict on this city.

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: I guess you know just about everything, don't you, Lance?

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: That I've hot wired the city's entire power supply through that catwalk.

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: Everything's going exactly as we planned.

turns.speaker: ANABEL
turns.text: Not quite. You haven't announced our engagement yet.

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: It must have slipped my mind.

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: Don't worry, Pootchkie. My womanizing days are over. You're my Lady Macbeth, my Imelda... my Nicole.  We're such an incredible team. Who could possibly stop us?

turns.speaker: ANABEL
turns.text: What are you doing all alone in the dark?

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: I'll be down in a jiffy.

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: Darling, you've got the wrong idea.

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: I was only strangling her... I've killed hundreds of women. It doesn't mean a thing.  Pootchkie, you're over-reacting. This is our night. It's what we've lied for... cheated for... murdered for. She's just a plaything, a trifle... You're the only woman who's ever meant anything to me. I adore you. I worship you. I want to make you my bride.

turns.speaker: SHOVELER
turns.text: The Bowler? I remember him from when I was a kid. He was killed years ago.

turns.speaker: SHOVELER
turns.text: Look, honey, being a superhero... it's a guy thing.

turns.speaker: BOWLER
turns.text: And then one day, he didn't come home. The police said it was an accident. But cargo containers don't just fall on people. He was murdered... After that I fell apart. I dropped out of school, became a mud wrestler, married and divorced a jerk. When my mother died I hit bottom... but then, when I was cleaning out her attic, I found my father's old bowling bag and costume, almost like he'd left them there for me... and I knew what I had to do.

turns.speaker: SHOVELER
turns.text: We didn't think this through very well.

turns.speaker: BOWLER
turns.text: My father had this friend... He was an inventor...

turns.speaker: BOWLER
turns.text: He was the last time I saw him.

turns.speaker: BOWLER
turns.text: We could really use some coffee --

turns.speaker: BOWLER
turns.text: Hey, do I look like a Man?

turns.speaker: SHOVELER
turns.text: Well we can't call ourselves the Mystery People.

turns.speaker: RAJA
turns.text: And you can't count Horst Buckholtz anyway.

turns.speaker: RAJA
turns.text: But they all had one thing we haven't got.

turns.speaker: BOWLER
turns.text: But she's your mother. You gotta tell her.

turns.speaker: RAJA
turns.text: I'm her only son, and she always had such high hopes for me. Medicine. Law.

turns.speaker: RAJA
turns.text: The cape. The turban. She wouldn't understand.

turns.speaker: BOWLER
turns.text: I know... My girlfriends all dumped me after I put on the mask. They thought I'd lost it.

turns.speaker: RAJA
turns.text: But in fact... you'd found it.

turns.speaker: BOWLER
turns.text: Come on, Junior, it's a school night.

turns.speaker: BOWLER
turns.text: They'll think we're just a bunch of weirdoes.

turns.speaker: RAJA
turns.text: But that place is huge and we don't know where this psycho thing is --

turns.speaker: BOWLER
turns.text: Or even what it looks like.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: Hey... Can I buy you a beer?

turns.speaker: BOWLER
turns.text: That's two more than the Fantastic Four.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: Casanova said that in two days the entire city would belong to him... and there wasn't a thing that we could do about it.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: It doesn't matter what we call ourselves. We know who we are.

turns.speaker: HELLER
turns.text: Elizabeth! Little Elizabeth! Why you're so... middle aged!

turns.speaker: HELLER
turns.text: Oh that's right -- they squished him... Heck of a guy.

turns.speaker: BOWLER
turns.text: Doc, these are my friends. We're superheroes, and we need your help.

turns.speaker: HELLER
turns.text: Well, I give to the United Way, and I feel that sort of covers --

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: I hope you enjoy these cigars. I had to kill a dozen Cubans to get them.

turns.speaker: TONY P
turns.text: You know, Mr. F, me and the boys always loved workin' for you. You had such style: the clothes, the dancin', the elegant way you'd snuff a babe. You were the King...

turns.speaker: TONY P
turns.text: But times have changed, and you been in that bug house a long tine. I can see you still got the style, but I dunno for sure you still got the edge.

turns.speaker: TONY P
turns.text: And I'm gonna nip it in the bud.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: What did you do with Captain Amazing?

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: I'll let you in on a little secret, Roy. In two days this entire city will belong to me, and there's not a damn thing your little pals can do about it. It's the perfect time to switch teams... So what do you say?

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: They always call the great ones nuts.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: And the nuts always call themselves great.

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: Are you with me... or against me?

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: Thanks for reminding me which team I'm on.

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: Let me guess... Bullets don't hurt you.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: They hurt... BUT THEY DON'T STOP ME!

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: I hope you won't take this the wrong way, but I couldn't help but notice... that you're a dead ringer for Veronica Lake in "The Blue Dahlia".

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: You know I'm writing a play -- it's just a little Broadway thing, but there's a part in it that I think you'd be perfect for.

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: I'd love to hear you read it. Could you stick around after the luncheon?

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: I thought you'd chickened out on me.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Just wanted to... powder my nose.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I'm not that kind of girl.

turns.speaker: CASANOVA
turns.text: I saw him walk you home.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: Doesn't it piss you off the way the when you really want to talk to somebody you can't think of anything to say!

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I guess... Are you always so angry?

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: Only when I'm awake... You busy after work?

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: Monica... I was wondering if -- uh -- maybe we -- I mean you and I -- could -- uh -- you know -- get a -- I mean have a...

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I get off work in fifteen minutes. Walk me home?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Being a superhero, wanting to save the world. It's so... unselfish.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Most people just want to make money or be famous or something. But you risk everything, just to help people.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I've never been able to figure out what to do with my life, which is why I guess I'm still a waitress.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: Nothing wrong with being a waitress.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Me too... I love this stupid old town. It's noisy. It's smelly. It's falling apart.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I've thought of leaving, going to Chicago or New York, but...

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: What have they got that we ain't got?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Champion's going to bounce back, and I want to be here when it does.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: You don't seem very angry right now.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: You know what? Underneath all that anger I think there's just a little boy who wants everyone to love him.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: I just want to be a superhero.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: Are you nuts? Get out of there!

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Listen, Casanova may be a supervillain, but he's got a weakness, and I'm it. Maybe -- just maybe -- I can trick him into showing me the location of the whatchamathing.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: He's a psycho! He'll kill you!

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Just shut up and listen. Hold off the attack as long as you can. If I can discover the location I'll call you --

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: And what if you get killed?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Then at least I will have died trying, right?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Roy... We might never see each other again, so I'd better tell you now... I think you're wonderful.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: So, let me get this straight. You have the power to become invisible.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: If someone looks at you, you immediately become visible again.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: So how do you know that you've ever been invisible?

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: Look, kid, we've got a lot of heroes to interview --

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE BOY
turns.text: I know I haven't got it entirely worked out yet, but I've always dreamed of becoming a superhero... Weren't you guys ever a kid? Didn't you ever need someone to just give you a chance?

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE BOY
turns.text: Come on, guys -- we're fighting against evil.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: Good or evil, what's the difference?

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: But now Casanova's back! And we're gonna sit around here all night eating pizza and telling stories! Hey, lets toast some marshmellows!

turns.speaker: SPHINX
turns.text: The wise snake coils before he strikes.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: When are you going to take off that mask?

turns.speaker: SPHINX
turns.text: When I am sure I am among friends.

turns.speaker: SPHINX
turns.text: Your rage is a very great power, but it blinds you to your heart.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: My heart died a long time ago.

turns.speaker: SPHINX
turns.text: It is not dead. It is hiding.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: Blow it out your bean hole, Pancho!... And to hell with the rest of you!... Look at you. Bunch of rejects. I didn't need you before -- and I don't need you now!  The great ones RIDE ALONE!  Adios, muchachos!

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: Maybe. But this isn't about living or dying. It's about good versus evil, and we're good, whether we like it or not... Maybe we look a little funny...

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: And smell a little funny. We're not bulletproof and we can't fly. But we're superheroes -- and that means doing what's right -- even when it's impossible... This is our city -- these are our friends, our families -- and if we don't save them, nobody will! So I say we take a ride up that hill, blast our way in there, destroy that Psycho-whatchamabob -- and teach those deviants a lesson they'll never forget!

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: We're all the same really. Our songs, our dreams, our seeds are all just a brave attempt to live forever.

turns.speaker: SPHINX
turns.text: He is in love. His anger is gone.

turns.speaker: SHOVELER
turns.text: Leave him alone. She's his mother, not yours.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: We had an off night, that's all.

turns.speaker: SHOVELER
turns.text: So when are we gonna have an on night?

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: What have the famous superheroes got that we don't?

turns.speaker: SHOVELER
turns.text: And it would be the right thing to do.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: I say we send out the word -- and summon all of the unsung superheroes we know!

turns.speaker: SHOVELER
turns.text: How could I see him if he's invisible?

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: You sure that's how you spell it?

turns.speaker: SHOVELER
turns.text: There's just not enough of us.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: But we know they're out there. Hundreds -- maybe thousands of lonely, unknown superheroes, who desperately need a cause...

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: I used to believe that. Now I'm not so sure.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: You know something? Those guys are really starting TO PISS ME OFF!

turns.speaker: SHOVELER
turns.text: But there's still only six of us.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: So what else has Superman got?

turns.speaker: SHOVELER
turns.text: He's got the fact that he's Superman!

turns.speaker: SHOVELER
turns.text: This place is built like a fortress.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: But I just don't feel it.

turns.speaker: FURIOUS
turns.text: Okay, you win. I'm pissed off. I'm seriously peeved.
